poem:
### The Naming of Submarines

In the deep, the silence reigns,  
Yet above, the tongues wag loud;  
Agincourt to Achilles—  
A name shifts with the will of men.  
And the sea, indifferent,  
Cradles the vessel still,  
As history whispers in waves—  
A quiet echo of pride and power,  
Unmoved by names alone.
